item.title: Allograph Neologism Uploaded
item.description: Bryan Ashley James Parry submitted a new Neologism, Allograph (n.). "An instantiation of a particular spelling under certain circumstances. For instance, the allograph of English /au/, word finally, is "aw". Likewise, the word-final instantiation of English /ai/ is "ay"."

item.title: The Duke Of Uranium Book-Media Posted
item.description: Jeffrey Henning added a new Book-Media, The Duke Of Uranium.

item.title: Language Identifier Resource Added
item.description: Jeffrey Henning added a new Resource, Language Identifier (Software).

item.title: Freecycle Neologism Page Edited
item.description: Michael Farnsworth edited the Neologism profile for Freecycle (v.). Heard it being used in 1987 and since then personally.

item.title: Munhan Neography Added
item.description: Jeffrey Henning added a new Neography, Munhan. "A unique featural writing system, where the features combine to create symbols that represent syllables while being evocative of Chinese characters."

item.title: Yudrûskd Babel Text Page Edited
item.description: stevo modified the Babel Text profile for Yudrûskd (Slang unumärghd - A blackened tongue). 20050730.

item.title: Fauxteur Neologism Posted
item.description: Dypsis Cabadae uploaded a new Neologism, Fauxteur (n.). "A "talentless, pretentious hack", usually in reference to a film director, but occasionally applied to any sort of director or even producer."

item.title: Flash Gordon: The Lion Men Of Mongo Book-Media Posted
item.description: Jeffrey Henning added a new Book-Media, Flash Gordon: The Lion Men Of Mongo.

item.title: Greenberg's Universals Resource Uploaded
item.description: Ansric uploaded a new Resource, Greenberg's Universals (Natural Language Reference). "Greenberg's "Some Universals Of Grammar With Particular Reference To The Order Of Meaningful Elements" (including his list of universals)."

item.title: Twitterati Neologism Added
item.description: David Johnson posted a new Neologism, Twitterati (n.). "A self-appointed elite of uninformed literary commentators."

item.title: Bukhstav Neography Posted
item.description:
Pete Bleackley uploaded a new Neography, Bukhstav (The runic alphabet of Khangaþyagon). "This is a runic alphabet used by the wizards of Huna to write Khangaþyagon. The romanisation is shown to the left of each rune, and corresponds to the CXS with the following exceptions
kh = [x]
a = [&] (long a = [a:]
þ = [T]
sh = [S]
r = [4]
ð = [D]
zh = [Z]
ng = [N]
y = [j]

Two forms of each vowel are shown - the first represents the short vowel, the second the long vowel. Diphthongs are represented by joining the long form of the first element to the short form of the second element at the upper point of the diagonal.

The last rune (marked ") is a gemination rune, which lengthens the preceding consonant."

item.title: Kor'ekhani Babel Text Entry Changed
item.description: J. Matthew Saunders updated the Babel Text profile for Kor'ekhani. Tweaked the grammar and the vocabulary.

item.title: IPA Keyboard Layout For Mac OS X Resource Submitted
item.description:
Jonathan Bettencourt submitted a new Resource, IPA Keyboard Layout For Mac OS X (Software). "

This is a link to download a keyboard layout for Mac OS X that will let you type IPA. Drop it in your ~/Library/Keyboard Layouts folder on OS X, check it in the International pref pane, and you can type IPA.

Keystrokes for the most part correspond with X-SAMPA. Shift gives you characters represented by a capital letter, and Option gives you characters represented by a letter with a tick (`) or slash after it. Shift-, followed by a letter will get you a voiced implosive, Shift-. will get you the apostrophe for ejectives. Option-` then a character (specifically the one after a _ in X-SAMPA) will put diacritics on things. R, Shift-R, Option-R, Option-Shift-R, 4, Option-Y, Option-U, and Option-I will get you all the different rhotics and R-shaped characters. Option-Shift-S/Z gets you /s\/ and /z\/, since Option-S/Z are taken by /s`/ and /z`/."

item.title: Snirt Neologism Uploaded
item.description: Mauro Baglieri uploaded a new Neologism, Snirt (n.). "Dirty snow."
